comment: I especially liked the way she broke down difficult concepts for easier understanding and was patient to reteach if something was unclear to me.
She welcomed everyone's opinions, and I can tell that she wants all of us to succeed in her course
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Content was good, and very informative. Very knowledgeable about content. She makes being in class a pleasure.

Professor Kim very obviously cares about what she teaches. She has an accent that may often seem difficult to understand but as far as content, the class is fairly easy. Attendance is necessary as she takes it daily and marks for tardies. Overall very fair, sweet, and if you work as you should, you will be fine ;)
Yanghee Kim was very sweet, hard to understand sometimes but is very passionate about her job and students. Grades very easy, take her!!

Terrible. Do not take her. She has a thick accent so it is hard to understand what she is saying. She also assigned observations in a classroom and for months, said it was 15 hours but suddenly 2 weeks before it is due, she now claims it has to be 20 hours. She is not consistent. Take someone else.
Dr. Kim is amazing and provides lots of information and knowledge.
I learned a lot through the readings and the hands on activities and presenting our projects in class.
Most of the time, the professor provided a welcoming environment for all.
She always tried to be engaging and make sure people had a chance to comment.

I took her online and the assingments are very long and confusing, she does not speak the best english so directions were commonly unclear she is a pretty tough grader but allows late work and will work with you
I learned a lot from Dr. Kim! She is a very sweet lady who loves her job.

Dr. Kim was a good professor. She has a passion for this course and her assignments were not hard, just took time to complete. She was not always clear on her instructions for assignments. Overall she was okay.
She was encouraging. She gives amazing, constructive feedback.
Very clear communication, very nice understanding

She was very timely with grading and responding to
assignments.

We had group projects where my group did none of the work. I tried explaining this to her because my grade would be affected due to no one else participating, but she would tell me to work alone. I think it was unfair because they were group assignments with a workload that's meant for group assignments. She was not understanding at all.
Dr. Kim is a great professor. I recommend taking her class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Kim was always available to help inside and outside of class time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I especially liked the way she broke down difficult concepts for easier understanding and was patient to reteach.
She makes being in class a pleasure. She is always positive and bring energy to the classroom.
Very knowlegeable about content, she is nice and understandable
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She always tried to be engaging during lectures and make sure people had a chance to comment.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: She is not a good professor so please do not take her if you don't have to. I learned a lot from this class. She is super tough in grading even though her instructions are veryyy unclear. If you put 100% effort into the assignments and you want to revise your work again for a better grade then she will give you a low grade for your assignment.

Dr. Kim was great in this course. She assigned work that was relevant and applicable to our field experience, and long term goals as educators. She grades fairly and accurately, all you have to do is follow the rubric AND DO THE WORK. She will not sugar coat her critique and assigns grades the student rightfully earns. She's a great communicator.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I LOVE Dr. Kim. I'm not sure if this was her first semester being a clinical Supervisor, but if so, I couldn't tell. She holds you accountable for all assignments and their deadlines, and offers her continued support in meeting course requirements. She gives honest, specific and detailed feedback, and accurate grading (DO THE WORK). She is patient.
I learned a lot about teaching preschool, and nothing seemed like busy work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kim was very patient and was organized. The class was a great learning experience.
Professor kim has valuable feedback.
she comments on all of our assignments so I know she is working on her end.

DO NOT TAKE! Save time, money, and your sanity and don't take her. She made this class harder than it should've been. The instructions are unclear and she's a tough grader. The assignments themselves are useless cause I didn't anything in this class.

She's a really nice person, but very bad professor. I'm surprised she has a high rating. This class was honestly a waste of my time and money. I learned absolutely nothing. Only stayed in it because its required for the program. She is super tough in grading even though her instructions are unclear. The assignments are really just busy work.

Dr. Kim is a sweet person but she did not handle the transition to online class due to COVID-19 well at all. She is such a tough grader and gave us a lot more work than we would have done in class. Her criteria is consistently unclear for her work, and she wont clear things up. This class was mandatory but Im not going to use it, so I wasted time
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Kim is great but this class is a waste of time! (It's mandatory in the program) Aside from that, she is great. Class is fun but if you don't come to class you won't pass. You have to participate in class discussions and activities, but if you seem interested and speak out, do your work with detail as well as work hard, easy Am she'll love you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: all of the documents you need for the field experience were organized and posted and was very supportive through out the semester.
She was very timely with grading and responding to assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very knowledgeable of the course
She is very particular when it comes to APA. She is not very helpful when asking for help with assignments and advice; not always clear with feedback. Do not take her if you don't have to.
She lets you know what you did right and wrong. It's so helpful to have that so you know how to continue.
Not a bad class. As long as you come to class and pay attention you'll be on her good side. Get your field experience done and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Kim is a very kind person and she loves Early Childhood Education. HOWEVER, she is very foreign. This makes her assignments and grading criteria very confusing. Her workload for her courses is VERY heavy. She will try to answer any questions you have,  but sometimes her answers will leave you more confused than before you asked.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I loved the learning the content of this class. Though I switched my major half way through the semester, I thoroughly enjoyed taking this class.
So sweet! She is always willing to help you out. You only meet in class 9 times the whole semester.

She is a well-known professor at KSU & I respect that. Her 2 hr 45 min class is a lot & was hard for me to focus. However she is very positive and tries to make class enjoyable. More online work than in class. Not very clear grading criteria; she seems confused a lot.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Kim is a very sweet person. She is willing to work with you if there is a problem. However, I would not recommend taking her. It is possible to get an A, but I cannot say I learned much, if anything, from this class. Fortunately, I could carry over material from other classes. Four major papers. No tests/ just quizzes. Go to class and buy book!
Dr. Kim is passionate, knowledgeable, willing to help subjects.
Very knowledgeable and approachable.
She is passionate, knowledgeable, willing to help subjects.
Gave feedback and showed genuine concern, made sure I was staying on track.
Overall great instructor.
She gives perfect amount of assignments. Most definitely the course has been helpful foe me to understand the subject.
She is professional and helpful. She is one of rare professors who read papers from the begining to the end. So, careful not to submit borrowed paper.

She is very professional and helpful. She is one of rare professors who read every project paper from the begining to the end. So, her complements are always highly regard among peers. Be careful not to submit the borrowed paper.

She has a good attitude, however she can be a little disorganize and all over the place. It can be a little difficult to understand her sometimes. Some of her assignments don't have rubrics, which make it hard to give her what she wants, and even if you ask her about it, you can still get lost on what you need to do and end up loosing points.

She is super hard to understand as well as her not being able to understand you at times. She is very unorganized and the first day of class she didnt even show up! Her teaching is all over the place and completely irrelevant to the class. She is completely boring but makes you attend the almost 3 hour class. Hated her as a teacher!

Dr. Kim is great. I was nervous to take her in case she had an accent but she is pretty easy to understand. She knows a lot about her subject and is very smart and encouraging. She is always there to answer questions. Half the classes are cancelled for this course for FE. Buy the book, it's very helpful and you need it to complete assignments.
